attributes.action: abandon plans to switch off FM coverage in the UK.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: DAB, and its successor, DAB+ delivers fewer stations and lower fidelity than FM – in any case digital broadcasting, should listeners wish to use it, is better implemented by the web (there is no limit on numbers of stations, and a higher bitrate – and therefore quality – is available). Also, digital broadcasting, unlike FM, works only when it has a strong and unambiguous signal – so coverage in difficult areas currently served adequately by FM may well not be possible and reception in cars nationwide will be problematic. We are about to have an inferior system foisted upon us, presumably to free up bandwidth for another sell off – which we, the people of Britain will subsidise by losing our treasured FM network. And at a time when green considerations are uppermost, can it be a sensible decision to render several complex electronic devices per household – millions nationwide – obsolete?

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
